<P class="p71 ft2">1.6. Duration and financial impact</P>
<P class="p150 ft1"><SPAN class="ft87">: </SPAN>Proposal/initiative of <SPAN class="ft2">unlimited duration</SPAN></P>
<P class="p13 ft1">Entry into force and start of application foreseen for 2015/2017 with compliance with proprietary trading ban as of January 2017 and potential separation requirements as of July 2018.</P>
<P class="p12 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">Management mode(s) planned</SPAN><SPAN class="ft80">44</SPAN></P>
<P class="p315 ft4">From the 2014 budget</P>
<P class="p289 ft2"><SPAN class="ft87">¬Ö </SPAN>Direct management <SPAN class="ft1">by the Commission</SPAN></P>
<P class="p188 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>by its departments, including by its staff in the Union delegations;</P>
<P class="p158 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>by the executive agencies;</P>
<P class="p289 ft1"><SPAN class="ft87">¬Ö </SPAN><SPAN class="ft2">Shared management </SPAN>with the Member States</P>
<P class="p304 ft1"><SPAN class="ft87">: </SPAN><SPAN class="ft2">Indirect management </SPAN>by delegating implementation tasks to:</P>
<P class="p158 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>third countries or the bodies they have designated;</P>
<P class="p188 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>international organisations and their agencies (to be specified);</P>
<P class="p158 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö</SPAN>the EIB and the European Investment Fund;</P>
<P class="p188 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>bodies referred to in Articles 208 and 209 of the Financial Regulation;</P>
<P class="p158 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>public law bodies;</P>
<P class="p316 ft6"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">¬Ö </SPAN>bodies governed by private law with a public service mission to the extent that they provide adequate financial guarantees;</P>
<P class="p317 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>bodies governed by the private law of a Member State that are entrusted with the implementation of a <NOBR>public-private</NOBR> partnership and that provide adequate financial guarantees;</P>
<P class="p318 ft6"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">¬Ö </SPAN>persons entrusted with the implementation of specific actions in the CFSP pursuant to Title V of the TEU, and identified in the relevant basic act.</P>
<P class="p248 ft92"><SPAN class="ft90">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft91">If more than one management mode is indicated, please provide details in the "Comments" section.</SPAN></P>

<P class="p147 ft1">EBA is a regulatory agency acting under the oversight of the Commission.</P>

<P class="p28 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft5">MANAGEMENT MEASURES</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">Monitoring and reporting rules</SPAN></P>
<P class="p44 ft6">The proposal foresees that the Commission should review the effectiveness of the proposed measures on a periodic basis.</P>
<P class="p77 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">Management and control system</SPAN></P>
<P class="p147 ft24"><SPAN class="ft24">2.2.1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft25">Risk(s) identified</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft1">In relation to the legal, economical, efficient and effective use of appropriations resulting from the proposal, it is expected that the proposal would not bring about new risks that would not be currently covered by EBA's existing internal control framework.</P>
<P class="p144 ft24"><SPAN class="ft24">2.2.2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft25">Information concerning the internal control system set up</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft94">n.a.</P>
<P class="p79 ft24"><SPAN class="ft24">2.2.3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft25">Estimate of the costs and benefits of the controls and assessment of the expected level of risk of error</SPAN></P>
<P class="p43 ft1">n.a.</P>
<P class="p147 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">Measures to prevent fraud and irregularities</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft1">For the purposes of combating fraud, corruption and any other illegal activity, the provisions of Regulation (EC) No 1073/1999 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 May 1999 concerning investigations conducted by the European <NOBR>Anti-Fraud</NOBR> Office (OLAF) shall apply to the EBA without any restriction.</P>
<P class="p14 ft1">EBA shall accede to the Interinstitutional Agreement of 25 May 1999 between the European Parliament, the Council of the European Union and the Commission of the European Communities concerning internal investigations by the European <NOBR>Anti-Fraud</NOBR> Office (OLAF) and shall immediately adopt appropriate provisions for all EBA staff.</P>
<P class="p31 ft1">The funding decisions and the agreements and the implementing instruments resulting from them shall explicitly stipulate that the Court of Auditors and OLAF may, if need be, carry out <NOBR>on-the-spot</NOBR> checks on the beneficiaries of monies disbursed by EBA as well as on the staff responsible for allocating these monies.</P>
<P class="p14 ft6">Articles 64 and 65 of the Regulation establishing EBA set out the provisions on implementation and control of the EBA budget and applicable financial rules.</P>

<P class="p330 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">3.2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft23">Estimated impact on expenditure</SPAN></P>
<P class="p331 ft1">This legislative initiative will have the following impacts on expenditures:</P>
<P class="p332 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">The hiring of two new temporary agents (TA) at EBA (2 TA as from January 2016) - See in Annex for more information on their roles and the way their costs were calculated (of which 40% will be funded by the EU and 60% by the Member States).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p332 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">The new tasks will be carried out with the human resources available within the annual budgetary allocation procedure, in the light of budgetary constraints which are applicable to all EU bodies and in line with the financial programming for agencies. Notably, the resources needed by the agency for the new tasks will be consistent and compatible with the human and financing programming for EBA set by the recent Communication to the European Parliament and the Council ‚Äì Programming of human and financial resources for decentralised agencies </SPAN><NOBR>2014-2020'</NOBR> (COM(2013)519).</P>

<P class="p432 ft24"><SPAN class="ft24">3.2.4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft156">Compatibility with the current multiannual financial framework</SPAN></P>
<P class="p382 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">: </SPAN>Proposal/initiative is compatible the current multiannual financial framework.</P>
<P class="p433 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft157">The resources needed by EBA for the new tasks will be consistent and compatible with the MFF </SPAN><NOBR>2014-2020</NOBR> and the human and financing programming for EBA set by the recent Communication to the European Parliament and the Council ‚Äì Programming of human and financial resources for decentralised agencies 2014- 2020 (COM(2013)519)."</P>
<P class="p434 ft6"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">¬Ö </SPAN>Proposal/initiative will entail reprogramming of the relevant heading in the multiannual financial framework.</P>
<P class="p435 ft29">Explain what reprogramming is required, specifying the budget lines concerned and the corresponding amounts.</P>
<P class="p436 ft94">[]</P>
<P class="p437 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">‚Äì</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">¬Ö </SPAN>Proposal/initiative requires application of the flexibility instrument or revision of the multiannual financial framework<SPAN class="ft7">56</SPAN>.</P>

<P class="p450 ft2">Annex on structural measures improving the resilience of EU credit institutions</P>
<P class="p451 ft2">Estimation for EBA</P>
<P class="p452 ft1">The proposal of the Commission includes provisions for EBA to develop four delegated acts and six technical standards that should ensure that provisions of a highly technical nature are consistently implemented across the EU.</P>
<P class="p453 ft1">The Commission should adopt regulatory technical standards developed by the EBA with regard to the methodology for the consistent measurement and application of the metrics relative to the calculation of the threshold above which separation of trading activities should take place. The Commission and the EBA should ensure that those standards can be applied by all institutions concerned in a manner that is proportionate to the nature, scale and complexity of those institutions and their activities. Additionally, the Commission should adopt implementing technical standards developed by the EBA with regard to the methodology for calculating the amount of trading activities engaged in by credit institutions and parent companies and the uniform template for disclosure of total amount and the components of credits institutions and parent companies' trading activities by means of implementing acts. The work foreseen requires bilateral and multilateral meetings with stakeholders, analysis and assessment of options and drafting of consultation documents, public consultation of stakeholders, setting up and management of standing expert groups composed of supervisors from Member States, setting up and management of ad hoc expert groups, analysis of the responses to consultations, drafting of cost/benefit analysis and drafting of the legal text.</P>
<P class="p454 ft1">It has been assumed that the Regulation will enter into force in the end of 2015. The additional EBA resources are therefore only required from 2016. Two temporary agents' posts will be needed to carry out the required tasks in the long term:</P>
<P class="p455 ft24">Commission delegated acts:</P>
<P class="p456 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Metrics: rebuttable presumption level, number;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p152 ft6"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft163">Provision of risk management products : cap above which RM products have to be provided by trading entity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p457 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Rules of separation ‚Äì large exposures: eligible credit risk mitigation techniques.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p458 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Territorial scope: criteria for equivalence</SPAN></P>
<P class="p459 ft24">Commission Technical Standards:</P>
<P class="p152 ft6"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft163">Propriety trading ban ‚Äì methodology for calculating trading activities for purposes of general threshold;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p190 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Proprietary trading ban ‚Äì uniform template for disclosure of trading activities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p456 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Separation - metrics: consistent measurement and application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p188 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Reporting obligation details and entry into force)</SPAN></P>
<P class="p456 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Registration of trade repositories</SPAN></P>
<P class="p188 ft1"><SPAN class="ft30"></SPAN><SPAN class="ft162">Authorities having access to trade repositories' data.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p459 ft1">Additional resources assumption:</P>
